actions.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.
Committee on Finance requested executive comment from OMB; Treasury Department.
Subcommittee on Taxation and Debt Management. Hearings held.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Taxation and Debt Management

official_title: A bill to amend section 280A of the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to permit Members of Congress to deduct expenses incurred while away from home in pursuit of trade or business on the same basis as other purposes.

summary.text: Amends the Internal Revenue Code to repeal the provision allowing an income tax deduction without substantiation for living expenses of Members of Congress.

titles.title: A bill to amend section 280A of the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to permit Members of Congress to deduct expenses incurred while away from home in pursuit of trade or business on the same basis as other purposes.
